container.heading: Membership in the Employees' System or the Teachers' System — General

section.heading: Determination by the Board of Trustees.
section.text: If the eligibility of an individual for membership in the Employees' Pension System or the Teachers' Pension System is unclear, the Board of Trustees shall determine whether the individual is a member of the Employees' Pension System or the Teachers' Pension System.

para.text: Membership in the Teachers' Pension System is optional for an individual who is appointed as a lecturer in the Overseas Division of University College.

An election to participate in the Teachers’ Pension System by an individual described in §A of this regulation shall be made within 90 days of commencement of employment and is a one-time irrevocable election.
The Retirement Agency may not deny an individual who is a member of the Teachers' Retirement System or the Employees' Retirement System before December 1, 1973, the right to:
Continue as a member of the Teachers' Retirement System or the Employees' Retirement System; or
Receive the accrued benefits to which the member was entitled.
Employees Enrolled in the Teachers' Retirement System in Error.

An individual enrolled in the Teachers' Retirement System may continue as a member of the Teachers' Retirement System if the individual was enrolled before October 1, 1972, as a result of an administrative error.
A recommendation of the Executive Director to remove an employee, enrolled for a period of 6 months or more after October 1, 1972, shall be submitted to the Board of Trustees for approval.

An individual may continue as a member of the Teachers' Retirement System or the Teachers' Pension System if the individual is promoted or transferred to a position in an excluded educational category.

section.heading: Membership in the Employees' Pension System.

para.text: Definitions.
In this regulation, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Contractual employee” means an individual who provides personal services to a participating employer for pay if all of the following conditions exist:
The services and pay are specified in a current written personal services agreement between the employer and an individual;
There is an employer-employee relationship between the participating employer and the individual; and

The individual does not receive any fringe benefits, except as provided by law or by statutorily authorized written policies adopted on or before November 6, 2017, which the employer has applied uniformly and which define a class of contractual employees who are entitled to receive specified fringe benefits.
“Emergency employee” means an individual who:
Is appointed by a participating employer to provide personal services on an emergency basis;
Is employed for a nonrenewable period not to exceed 6 months; and
Except as provided by law, does not receive any fringe benefits.
“Temporary extra employee” means an individual who:
Provides personal services to a participating employer;
Is employed for a nonrenewable period not to exceed 6 months; and
Except as provided by law, does not receive any fringe benefits.
The following individuals shall be excluded from membership in the Employees' Pension System:
Subject to §C of this regulation, a contractual, emergency, or temporary extra employee of a participating employer;
Employees of the Maryland Center for Public Broadcasting under the 9,000 series;
Resident doctors; and
School crossing guards who:
Are employed by a participating governmental unit:
On a substitute or relief basis, or
For less than 500 hours; and
Except as provided by law, do not receive any fringe benefits from the participating governmental unit.

The fact that a participating employer permitted an individual to enroll in the Employees’ Pension System shall not be relevant to the determination of whether the individual is a contractual, emergency, or temporary extra employee who is excluded from membership.
